data.text: And Job continued and said in his parable,
Oh that I were as in months past, wherein God preserved me!
As when his lamp shone over my head;
As when I steadfastly pursued my ways,
When I was very fruitful,
When my ways were moistened with butter,
When I went forth early in the city,
The young men saw me, and hid themselves:
And the great men ceased speaking,
And they that heard me blessed me,
For the ear heard, and blessed me;
For I saved the poor out of the hand of the oppressor,
Let the blessing of the perishing one come upon me;
Also I put on righteousness,
I was the eye of the blind,
I was the father of the helpless;
And I broke the jaw teeth of the unrighteous;
And I said, My age shall continue as the stem of a palm tree;
My root was spread out by the water,
My glory was fresh in me,
Men heard me, and gave heed,
At my word they spoke not again,
As the thirsty earth expecting the rain,
Were I to laugh at them, they would not believe it;
I chose out their way, and sat chief,
